Authors: Radhia F., Ahdiani H., Wang G., Sfenrianto
Title: Exploring challenges using smart contract in healthcare industry
Source title: International Journal of Advanced Trends in Computer Science and Engineering
Affiliations: Information Systems Management Department, BINUS-Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Radhia, F., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS-Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Ahdiani, H., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS-Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wang, G., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS-Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sfenrianto, Information Systems Management Department, BINUS-Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: During the Industrial Revolution 4.0 era, the block chain was used as a digital record of transactions that is simultaneously used and shared within a large decentralized, publicly accessible network. In order to maintain the healthcare sector in Industrial Revolution 4.0, smart contracts are used to provide those addresses which provide transparent ways to do transactions among entities. In the other hand, the adoption has challenges, such as the adoption curve, the complexity of the business ecosystems and standardization, data privacy, and people expectations in the healthcare industry. © 2020, World Academy of Research in Science and Engineering. All rights reserved.
